intro: Eremocarya muricata, commonly known as the rough eremocarya, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, adapting well to harsh, dry environments. Eremocarya muricata is often found in steppes and mountainous areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
